Description: Our Studio Arts course studies the techniques and creative processes of Fine Art disciplines for personal expression, aesthetic experience, and visual communication of themes and ideas. This course offers a variety of mediums to work in such as drawing, painting, sculpture, printmaking, sculpture, and ceramics

Program Name: DRAWN TO DESIGN: The Art Of The Graphic Novel
Description: We’ll take a closer look at how these beloved stories come to life, seeing how writers and illustrators work together to turn zany ideas to captivating panels on the page. We’ll hone basic drawing skills like proportion, shading, and perspective as we create our own long-format graphic novel throughout the session, picking up some bookbinding know-how along the way.

Claymation is a fun and engaging process perfect for hands-on learners that brings creativity and exploration to the classroom. In this course we’ll build our own mini sets and animate characters out of modeling clay, record voice work and sound effects, and, of course, film the finished project still-by-still.

We’ll take classic hand-building, 3D design, and sculptural techniques to the next level in an after school class that combines form and function, exploring the possibilities of objects as works of art.
